translated: 2 YogÄcÄrabhÅ«mi ÅšÄstra, fascicle 10
Spoken by Maitreya Bodhisattva
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
In the Basic Section, there are three grounds such as with applied thought and sustained thought. What is desire for sensual pleasures?
It is the defiled longing for the activities of the desire realm that arise with the activities of the desire realm as their object.
Because of this, the painful results of the desire realm are produced.
What is desire for form?
It is the defiled longing for the activities of the form realm that arise with the activities of the form realm as their object.
Because of this, the painful results of the form realm are produced.
What is desire for the formless?
It is the defiled longing for the activities of the formless realm that arise with the activities of the formless realm as their object.
Because of this, the painful results of the formless realm are produced.
What is grasping at sensual pleasures?
It is the desire and greed for sensual pleasures.
What is grasping at views?
It is the desire and greed for the remaining views, except for the view of a real self.
What is grasping at morality and ritual?
It refers to the desire and greed for the precepts and observances that arise from wrong aspirations.
What is the grasping of the theory of self?
It refers to the desire and greed for the view of the aggregates.
The first [grasping] can only give rise to the suffering fruits of the desire realm.
The other three can give rise to the suffering fruits of the three realms.
What is the existence of desire?
It refers to the prior existence in the desire realm,
the existence of karma,
the existence at death,
the intermediate existence,
the existence at birth,
and the existence of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, humans, and gods.
This is collectively called the existence of desire.
Moreover, it is perfumed and produced by the various past practices and afflictions that are embraced.
What is the existence of form?
It refers to the existence of form that excludes the existence of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, and humans.
This should be understood.
What is the existence of the formless?ğŸ”½It refers to the formless existence that excludes the intermediate existence.
This should be understood.
What is the meaning on which the establishment of the seven existences is based?
Namely, the existences of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, humans, and gods.
There is intermediate existence for karma.
Answer: It is based on three kinds of activities.
First, attracting existence.
That is, one.
Second, heading towards existence.
That is, one.
Third, experiencing the fruition of existence.
That is, five.
What is birth?
That is, in the two kinds of birth from womb and egg.
When first entering birth.
What is equal birth?
That is, in those very bodies, when the limbs are fully formed, but one has not yet emerged.
What is heading towards?
That is, emerging from there.
What is arising?
That is, having emerged, growing.
What is appearing?
That is, in the two kinds of birth from moisture and spontaneous, the limbs suddenly arise.
What is the attainment of the aggregates?
That is, in those very states of birth,
the five appropriated aggregates continue.
What is the attainment of the elements?
That is, the nature of those very aggregates that is included in the causes and conditions.
What is the attainment of the sense bases?
That is, the nature of those very aggregates that is included in the other conditions.
What is the arising of the aggregates?
It refers to those aggregates being nourished by daily food and drink, and the life faculty.
What is appearance?
It refers to those aggregates continuing to exist due to the power of remaining lifespan.
The concise meaning of the link of birth is as follows:ğŸ”½If it is the essence of birth,
if it is the stage of birth,
if it is what is born,ğŸ”½if it is included in the causes and conditions,
if it is what is brought forth by support,
if it is the simultaneous support of birth,
this is called the concise meaning.
What is decline?
It refers to causing agitation by relying on inferiority.
What is old age?
It refers to the change in the color of hair.
What is wrinkled?
It refers to the skin being loose and wrinkled.
What is mature?
It refers to the weakening of digestive fire.
One lacks the power to enjoy sense objects.
What is the loss of vitality?
It refers to being prone to many illnesses.
One lacks the power to engage in activities.
What is the body being mottled with dark spots?
It refers to the appearance of darkness that damages one's complexion.
What is meant by the spine being bent and breathing rapidly?
It refers to the deportment of walking.
The body is revealed.
This gives rise to extremely heavy coughing.
What is meant by the appearance being bent forward?
It refers to the deportment of sitting.
The body and head are bent down.
What is meant by leaning on a cane?
It refers to the deportment of standing.
One stands by the power of a cane.
What is meant by being confused?
It refers to the deportment of lying down.
One sleeps heavily again and again.
What is meant by being weak?
It refers to being unable to wake up quickly in this state.
What is meant by being diminished?
It refers to the decline of mindfulness and wisdom.
What is meant by decline?
It refers to being unable to engage in wholesome dharmas due to the inferiority of mindfulness and wisdom.
What is meant by the faculties being aged and mature?
It refers to the body being emaciated.
What is meant by the destruction of function?
It refers to no longer being clear and sharp regarding objects.
What is the decay of conditioned things?
It refers to when they are about to die.
What is the corruption of the body?
It refers to when the life span is about to end.
The physical form is about to perish.
In all activities,
one no longer has the ability.
The brief meaning of this aging is:
It refers to the degeneration of the support, the degeneration of hair and beard,
the degeneration of fullness and joy,
the degeneration of digestive heat,
the degeneration of health,
the degeneration of physical appearance,
the degeneration of deportment,ğŸ”½the degeneration of the formless faculties,
the degeneration of the form faculties,ğŸ”½the passing of time,
and the imminent end of the life span.
The brief meaning should be understood.
What are those sentient beings?
It refers to hell beings and so forth.
What is the type of sentient beings?
It refers to all of them.
What is death?
It refers to when sentient beings die with their limbs and joints intact.
What is destruction?
It refers to when sentient beings die with their limbs and joints severed.
What is destruction?
It refers to consciousness leaving the body.
What is submergence?
It refers to the cessation of the physical faculties.
What is the abandonment of life?
It refers to the stage where the breath is about to cease.
What is the abandonment of heat?
It refers to the stage of immobility, where one abandons the aggregates.
What is the cessation of the life faculty?
It refers to dying at the proper time.
What is death?
It refers to dying prematurely due to adverse conditions.
What is the exhaustion of life?
It refers to the stage of initial death, not long after death.
Moreover, the activity of the demon of death is called the exhaustion of life.
The concise meaning of this death is as follows:ğŸ”½It refers to either death itself or the factors of death,
or the distinctions in death,
or the stage after death.
This is called the concise meaning.
In this way, the distinctions in dependent origination should be understood.
What is the reason?
Why are the factors of existence such as ignorance
explained in this sequence?
The answer is: Those who are ignorant
must first be ignorant of what should be known,
and then they give rise to wrong practices with regard to that.
Because of wrong practice.
It causes the mind to be inverted.
Because the mind is inverted,ğŸ”½It forms the bond of rebirth.
Because of the bond of rebirth,
The faculties are fully developed.
Because the faculties are fully developed,
There are two kinds of enjoyment of objects.
Because of enjoying objects,
If one becomes attached or desires,
Because of desire,
When seeking in various ways,ğŸ”½Afflictions increase.
Because afflictions increase,
One gives rise to actions of love and hate that lead to rebirth.
Because of the power of the increase of the actions that are given rise to,
The fruits of suffering are born in the five destinies of birth and death.
When the fruits of suffering are born,
There is the suffering of old age and death, and so forth.
That is to say, the suffering of old age and death brought about by the internal body's changes,
And the suffering of worry and lamentation brought about by the changes in objects.
The suffering of heat and distress.
Therefore, the World-Honored One,
Explained the twelve links in this order.
There is also a different sequence,
Which is based on two kinds of conditions.
The sequence of dependent origination is established.
First, the condition of the internal body.
Second, the condition of enjoying objects.
The condition of the internal body.
Is included in the first six factors.
The condition of enjoying objects.
Is included in the last six factors.
First, one gives rise to the delusion of grasping at self within one's own body.
Because of this, one does not understand the ripening of suffering that is attracted by karma.
Therefore, one gives rise to karma.
Once one has given rise to it,
One then follows that karma.
And gives rise to much discursive thought.
Because karma serves as an auxiliary condition for consciousness,
It is able to attract the three kinds of suffering in the future.
Namely, the suffering that is included in the initial arising of the faculties,ğŸ”½The suffering that is included in the completion of the faculties,
And the suffering that is included in enjoying objects.
Namely, name-and-form come first,
And contact is the last.
Moreover, in the present life,
Dependent on contact as a condition, one gives rise to craving.
Because of enjoying objects,
One widely gives rise to seeking.ğŸ”½Either through the door of work
Or through the door of gain.
Or through the gate of precepts and observances.
Or through the gate of liberation.
Giving rise to the desire to seek internally, seeking internally.
Seeking wrong liberation.
When seeking in this way,
It causes the fruits of the five destinies of birth and death, which were previously drawn forth by afflictions and karma, to arise.
Having already obtained birth,
Old age and death follow.
There is also a sequence of distinctions.
Namely, due to three kinds of groups of sentient beings.ğŸ”½One delights in transcending the world and purifying.
One delights in purifying the world.
One delights in being attached to objects.
Due to the first group,
All dependent origination is extinguished.
The pure white class increases.
Due to the second group of sentient beings,
One does not truly understand the principles of the truths.
If one abides in right mindfulness,
Either one creates meritorious karma,
Or one creates immovable karma drawn forth by contaminated cultivation.
If one does not abide in right mindfulness,
One then creates non-meritorious karma.ğŸ”½Or it draws forth that which is regretted,
Or it draws forth the mind that is not regretted but joyfully.
Continuation and abiding.
They also, as before, in the sequence of lower, middle, and upper birth places,
Are able to attract the three kinds of suffering in the future.
Name and form are first,
Contact is last.
Due to the third group of sentient beings.
Based on the feelings that arise from the presently experienced objects,
In the present life, in the sequence as before,
The latter six factors arise.
Feeling is first,
Old age and death are last.
In the middle,
Old age and death are first,
Explaining the dependent origination.
The answer is: Based on the principle of explaining the truths.
Because birth and old age and death can manifest the truth of suffering.
As the World-Honored One said:
The cessation of the new name-and-form is the foremost Dharma.
Why not say the cessation of all ignorance is foremost?
The answer is: Based on those who are liberated in mind,
And because of that, in the present life,
The suffering of seeds,
And the suffering of future results,
Do not arise and cease.
Therefore, it is said that name-and-form come first.
Feeling is the last.
It attains ultimate cessation.
Moreover, in the present life,
when one experiences various feelings,
craving and latent tendencies
are forever eradicated and do not arise again.
This is called cessation.
Because of the cessation of that,
taking that as the basis,
the other factors also cease.
This is the kind of
explanation of the sequence of dependent origination that should be known.
Because afflictions bind one and one repeatedly arises in various destinies,
it is called dependent origination.
This is the etymological explanation of the name.
Moreover, relying on various conditions,
quickly perishes,
and continues to arise in combination.
Therefore, it is called dependent origination.
This is the explanation based on the meaning of a moment.
Moreover, past conditions are not abandoned,ğŸ”½but arise based on one's own continuity.
Therefore, it is called dependent origination.
As it is said, Because this exists, that exists.
Because this arises, that arises.
Not otherwise.
Based on this meaning,
The names should be understood.ğŸ”½Moreover, it is called dependent origination because it frequently passes away
and arises in continuity again.
This is explained based on the meaning of frequently being destroyed and extinguished.ğŸ”½Moreover, it is called dependent origination because after realizing the nature of conditions in the past,
it arises in continuity with the same characteristics.
As the World-Honored One said:
I have already realized it.
I am now expounding it.
It is called dependent origination because it is transmitted through this name.
How many kinds of conditions are there?
The answer is: Regarding form and volitional formations,
it is the dominant condition.
Regarding formless volitional formations,
it is three conditions,ğŸ”½namely the immediately preceding condition,
the object condition,
and the dominant condition.
The other members as conditions should be understood in this way.
That is to say, regarding the form members, they are one dominant condition regarding the form members.
They are two conditions regarding the formless members,
namely the object condition
and the dominant condition.
If the formless factors are considered in relation to the form factors, they are only one condition.
If they are considered in relation to the formless factors, they are three conditions.ğŸ”½Namely, the condition as direct antecedent,
the condition as object,
and the dominant condition.
Why is it that the various factors are not the condition as cause in relation to each other?
The answer is:
The condition as cause is manifested by the seeds of one's own essence.
If the various factors are not the condition as cause in relation to each other,
why is it said that dependent arising is established based on the essence of cause and effect?
The answer is: It is based on the condition as dominance, which includesğŸ”½the projecting cause,
the attracting cause,
and the productive cause.
Therefore, it is called cause.
How many factors are included in the projecting cause?
The answer is: From ignorance up to feeling.
How many factors are included in the productive cause?
The answer is: From craving up to becoming.
How many factors are included in both the projected and produced causes and effects?
The answer is: In the present life and the future life,
consciousness and so forth up to feeling.
In the states of birth, old age, and death,
the various members that are included,
causes,
for what causes and conditions,
in the teachings on dependent origination,
are they not explained first?
The answer is: they are only uninterrupted causes,
not causes of defilement.
Why is this?
Those who are not ignorant do not give rise to this thought.
The teachings on dependent origination are based on the causes of defilement.
The nature of ignorance is defiled,
while the nature of improper attention
is not defiled.
Therefore, it cannot defile ignorance.
However, it is defiled by the power of ignorance.
Moreover, it is perfumed by the power of the karma and afflictions that give rise to defilement, the initial cause of karma.
That is, the initial dependent origination.
Therefore, improper attention is not explained.
Why is it not said that the self-nature
is the condition for the self-nature?
The answer is: if the self-nature does not obtain other conditions,
it cannot increase the defilement of the self-nature.
and it does not diminish.
Therefore, it is not mentioned.
Question: For what reasons are meritorious actions and immovable actions
arisen through the power of correct discernment
still said to have ignorance as a condition?
Answer: Due to not understanding the worldly truth of suffering as a condition,
non-meritorious actions arise.
Due to not understanding the ultimate truth of suffering as a condition,
meritorious and immovable actions are produced.
Therefore, they are also said to have ignorance as a condition.
Question: As the sutras say that all actions have craving, hatred, and delusion as conditions,
why is it only said here that they have delusion as a condition?
Answer: Here, it is said in general that the conditions for meritorious, non-meritorious, and immovable actions
are only the causes for the production of non-meritorious actions through craving, hatred, and delusion.
Question: Bodily actions and verbal actions
are initiated by volition,
so volition is also a condition for volition.
Why is it only said that ignorance is a condition for volition?
Answer: It is said based on the condition that initiates all actions.
And because it is said that good and defiled volition arises in dependence on it.
Question: Consciousness also has name-and-form as a condition.
Why is only action said to be a condition here?
Answer: Action is the condition for the defilement of consciousness.
Because it can attract and give rise to the fruits of subsequent existence.
Unlike name-and-form, which is only a support and object condition for arising.
Question: Name-and-form is also created by the great elements.
And it arises due to contact.
Why is only consciousness said to be a condition?
Answer: Because consciousness is the cause for their new arising.
Once they have arisen,
or when they are just about to arise,
the great elements and contact
are only the establishing causes for them.
Question: As it is said in the sutra,
the six elements are the conditions for entering the mother's womb.
Why is only the element of consciousness mentioned here?
Answer: If there is the element of consciousness,
it is certain that in the mother's womb,
the great elements of semen and blood
will not be lacking in the womb.
Moreover, because the element of consciousness is superior,
It is also said that all existences arise based on the arising of all existences.
Question: The six sense bases are also conditioned by food and drink.
Why is it only said here that name-and-form is a condition?
Answer: It is said here that name-and-form is the cause of their arising.
After they have arisen,
they are also conditioned by food and drink as a cause of maintenance.
Question: Contact is conditioned by the three combined.
Why is it only said here that the six sense bases are a condition?
Answer: If there are the six sense bases,
the other two definitely exist without deficiency.
Also, because the six sense bases are superior,
because the six sense bases include the two kinds.
Question: If one is oppressed by oneself,
if one is oppressed by others,
if there is a change in the seasons,
if it is drawn by past karma,
one can give rise to feeling.
Why is it only shown here that contact is a condition for that?
Answer: Because contact is their proximate cause,
because it is drawn by contact,
feeling arisen from other conditions
is also born from contact.
It must not be apart from contact.
Therefore, it is said in a biased way.
Question: The sÅ«tras also say that ignorance as a condition gives rise to craving.
Favorable objects
can also be conditions.
Why is only feeling said to be a condition here?
Answer: Because of the power of feeling,
with regard to similar objects,
either seeking union
or seeking separation,
due to the power of delusion,
one simply does not truly understand the characteristics of arising and cessation with regard to all feelings.
Because of this, one is unable to control one's mind.
Question: Because the latent tendencies have not yet been eliminated,
the dharmas that accord with them
can all arise through grasping.
Why is only craving said to be a condition for grasping here?
Answer: Because of the arising of desire,
when pursuing,
one is able to give rise to the latent tendencies
and able to attract the dharmas that accord with them.
Question: It was already said previously that ignorance as a condition gives rise to karma and existence.
Why is grasping as a condition for existence said here now?
Answer: Because of the power of grasping,
It causes those actions to be able to attract the fruits of consciousness, name-and-form, etc. in those various places of rebirth.
Question: Birth also takes semen, blood, etc. as conditions.
Why is it only said here that existence has conditions for birth?
Answer: Because there is existence,
there are definitely other conditions without deficiency.
Moreover, because there is superiority,
only that is said to be a condition.
Question: It is also due to going far,
not avoiding inequality,
and being oppressed by others as a condition,
that old age and death can be obtained.
Why is it only said here that birth is a condition for old age and death?
Answer: Although it is due to those conditions,
it definitely takes birth as the fundamental cause.
Even if those conditions are lacking,
as long as there is birth as a condition,
old age and death will definitely exist.
Question: How many of these twelve links are the path of afflictions,
how many are the path of karma,
and how many are the path of suffering?
Answer: Three are the path of afflictions,
two are the path of karma,
and the rest are the path of suffering.
Question: How many are only causes,
How many are only results?
How many are both causes and results?
The answer is: The first is only a cause.
The last is only a result.
The rest are both causes and results.
Moreover, regarding this question,
another answer is given.
Three are only causes.
Two are only results.
The rest should be known as both causes and results.
How many are unique characteristics?
How many are mixed characteristics?
The answer is: Three are unique characteristics.
Action, etc., are mixed characteristics.
Why is action a mixed characteristic?
The answer is: Because of two kinds of explanations.
That is, because it can lead to desirable and undesirable results,
and because it can give rise to the distinctions of destinies.
Why are consciousness, name-and-form, and six sense bases partially mixed characteristics?
The answer is: Because of three kinds of explanations.ğŸ”½That is, based on the time of defilement,
based on the time of moistening,
and based on the time of transformation.
Why are consciousness up to feeling and old age and death mixed characteristics?
The answer is: Because of two kinds of explanations.
Because it specifically reveals the characteristics of suffering.
And because it reveals the differences in what is drawn forth.
Furthermore, in the dependent origination,
What is the meaning of repeatedly going?
It means the meaning of not abiding after being born.
What is the meaning of combination?
It means the meaning of the aggregation of conditions.
What is the meaning of arising?
It means the meaning of newly arising that is drawn forth by the combination of conditions.
What is dependent origination?
What is dependent arising?
The inherent nature of the arising of conditioned phenomena is called dependent origination.
That which has arisen is called dependent arising.
How many members are included in the truth of suffering and are suffering in the present life?
The answer is two.
Namely, birth and old age and death.
How many members are included in the truth of suffering?
Are they suffering in the future?
The answer is from consciousness up to feeling in the nature of seeds.
How many members are included in the truth of the accumulation [of suffering]?
The answer is the remaining members.ğŸ”½Does ignorance act as a simultaneous condition for volitional actions,
Or as an immediately preceding condition?
to be the condition for distant cessation.
The answer should be understood to be the three conditions.
That is to say, due to ignorance,
in the dharmas that accord with the various activities,ğŸ”½it is the condition of simultaneous obstruction and concealment.
For each and every matter,
it gives rise to the various activities.
Moreover, due to the ignorance that accompanies evil views and heedlessness,
it is the condition for the arising of immediate cessation.
It gives rise to the various activities.
Moreover, due to ignorance,
it is the condition for distant attraction and instigation.
It establishes the continuity of the characteristics that will accord with it in the future.
How should one understand that the various activities are the three kinds of conditions for consciousness?
The answer is: because it can perfume and give rise to their seeds,
it is the condition of simultaneity.
Next, because of the power of that, it transforms,
it is the condition for the arising of immediate cessation.
Because the fruit of that will be born in the future,
it is the condition for distant attraction and instigation.
Just as the activities are in relation to consciousness,
in the same way, consciousness is in relation to name-and-form.
Name-and-form is in relation to the six sense bases.
The six sense bases with respect to contact.
Contact with respect to feeling is also like this.
Question: How should one understand feeling with respect to craving as three kinds of conditions?
Answer: One should know that because of the arising of pleasure and attachment,
it is the co-existent condition.
Immediately after this, due to its power,
the function of pursuing and so forth arises and transforms,
so it is the condition of arising from the immediately past cessation.
Establishing the future,
because that continuity is difficult to liberate from its characteristics,
it is the condition of attraction from the distant past cessation.
Question: How is craving with respect to grasping as three kinds of conditions?
Answer: Because of being associated with desire and greed,
in the dharmas that accord with grasping, one establishes the desire and pleasure,
so it is the co-existent condition.
Because of the transformation by the power of the immediately past cessation,
it is the condition of arising.
Establishing the future,
because that continuity is difficult to liberate from it,
it is the condition of attraction from the distant past cessation.
Question: How is grasping with respect to existence as three kinds of conditions?
Answer: Because they accompany it and enable karma to attract the fruits of the destinies,
they are the co-existent condition.ğŸ”½Moreover,
because of their power, they can attract consciousness, etc. in this place of birth,
they are the immediately preceding condition for arising.
Moreover, because they can attract the power of that realm,
they are the condition for attraction that has long since ceased.
Question: How does existence serve as three kinds of conditions for birth?
Answer: Because it perfumes and produces their seeds,
it is the co-existent condition.
Because it arises immediately after them and continues,
it is the condition for arising.
Although it has long since ceased,
because the fruit continues,
it is the condition for attraction.
Just as existence is in relation to birth,
one should know that birth is in relation to old age and death,
and the conditions are also like this.
Furthermore, there are two kinds of establishment of the members of existence:
First, establishment according to the superior part,
which refers to the karma that is included in grasping,
as explained above.
Second, complete establishment,
which refers to karma and consciousness.
up to the seeds of all that is experienced.
The appropriation of grasping.
It should be known that the establishment of existence is based on this.
Question: As for these links of existence,
they only have sequential conditions and act as conditions for action.
Up to old age and death, do they have any other functions?
Answer: These very functions and in the various individual objects,
according to what is appropriate,
all the functions that exist should be known.
This is called the second function.
Question: Does ignorance only act as a condition for action,
or does it also act as a condition for other links?
Answer: Ignorance up to also acts as a condition for old age and death.
The previous statement that it only acts as a condition for action
only explains the meaning of a proximate condition.
In this way, the rest should all be understood.
Furthermore, the later links are not conditions for the earlier links.
Why is it so?ğŸ”½It is like diligently making effort to eliminate the later links
and eliminating the earlier links.
Because the earlier are eliminated, the later are also eliminated.
It is not for the sake of severing the former that one diligently makes effort to sever the latter part.
Therefore, one should know that
this alone is the condition for that.
Question: Why is it said that because this exists, that exists?
Answer: Because the remaining can arise due to the meaning of the condition of non-severance.
Question: Why is it said that because this arises, that arises?
Answer: Because the remaining can arise due to the meaning of the condition of impermanence.
Question: Why is it said that because there is birth, there is old age and death?
Old age and death exist only due to the condition of birth.
In the same way, up to ignorance with regard to karmic formations.
Answer: Because this teaching and principle
show the meaning of the remaining arising due to the condition of unreal function.
Question: Why is it said that because there is birth, there is old age and death?
Old age and death do not exist apart from the condition of birth.
In the same way, up to ignorance with regard to karmic formations.
Answer: Because this teaching and principle
show the meaning of the remaining arising from the condition of one's own continuum.
Question: If a dharma is conditioned by ignorance,
is that dharma a formation?
If it is a formation,
is ignorance its condition?
Answer: Four sentences should be made.
There may be formations that are not conditioned by ignorance.
Namely, pure and unrestrained indeterminate bodily, verbal, and mental formations.
There may be that which is conditioned by ignorance but is not a formation.
Namely, except for the member of existence included in formations,
the remaining members of existence.
There may be that which is both conditioned by ignorance and a formation.
Namely, meritorious, non-meritorious, and immovable bodily, verbal, and mental formations.
Except for this kind of characteristic, this is the fourth sentence.ğŸ”½Question: If a formation is a condition, is it also consciousness?
If it is consciousness, is the formation its condition?
Answer: Four sentences should be made.
There may be a condition that is a formation but not consciousness.
Namely, except for consciousness, the remaining members of existence.
There may be consciousness that is not a condition that is a formation.
Namely, pure consciousness and unrestrained indeterminate consciousness,
except for that arisen from karmic ripening.
Or it is both consciousness and action as conditions.
Namely, the seeds of future existence and the resultant consciousness.
Excluding these characteristics.
This is the fourth alternative.
By this principle.
Up to contact as a condition for feeling.
According to what is appropriate.
The four alternatives should be understood.
Question: If feeling is a condition, is it all craving? If it is craving, is it all conditioned by feeling?
Answer: Four alternatives should be made.
There may be craving that is not conditioned by feeling.
Namely, the aspiration for liberation and the relinquishment of other cravings based on wholesome craving.
There may be that which is conditioned by feeling but is not craving.
Namely, excluding the feeling produced by the contact of ignorance as a condition.
The arising of other factors of existence.
There may be that which is conditioned by feeling and is also craving.
Namely, the feeling produced by the contact of ignorance as a condition.
The arising of defiled craving.
Excluding these characteristics, this is the fourth alternative.
Question: If craving is a condition, is it all grasping?
If it is grasping, is it all conditioned by craving?
Answer: You should know that here it is the latter phrase that is correct.
That is to say, all grasping is conditioned by craving.
Or it is conditioned by craving but not grasping.
That is to say, except for grasping, the remaining factors of existence.
And the arising of wholesome factors such as wholesome effort conditioned by wholesome craving.
Question: If grasping is the condition, is it all existence?
If it is existence, is it all conditioned by grasping?
Answer: You should also make the latter phrase correct.
That is to say, all existence is conditioned by grasping.
Or it is conditioned by grasping but not existence.
That is to say, except for existence, the remaining factors of existence.ğŸ”½Question: If existence is the condition, is it all birth?
If it is birth, is it all conditioned by existence?
Answer: All birth is conditioned by existence.
Or it is conditioned by existence but not birth.
That is to say, except for birth, the remaining factors of old age and death, the last factor of existence.
Question: If birth is the condition, is it all old age and death?
Are all old age and death conditioned by birth?
Answer: All old age and death are conditioned by birth.
Or there may be that which is conditioned by birth but not old age and death.
Namely, disease,
union with the hated,
separation from the loved,
not obtaining what one seeks,
and the various kinds of distress, lamentation, sorrow, and suffering that arise from them.
The various kinds of distress.
Question: Among these links of existence, how many are the supreme obstacles to the right view included in the path?
Answer: Ignorance and the mental activities that arise from it.
If there is one part that can be a supreme obstacle,
Just as with right view,
so it is with right thought
and right effort.
If right speech, right action, and right livelihood
are with bodily action, verbal action,
and one part,
they are the supreme obstacles.
If right livelihood and right concentration
are with the remaining links of existence,
they should be known as the supreme obstacles.
Question: Among these links of existence, how many are only defiled?
How many are associated with the defiled and pure categories?
Answer: Four are only associated with the defiled category.
The rest are associated with both the defiled and pure categories.
Question: How is the member of birth associated with both categories?
Answer: If one is born in an evil realm or a difficult place,
it is only associated with the defiled category.
If one is born as a human or god in a place without difficulties,
it is associated with both the defiled and pure categories.
One should know that the other members
are all associated with both categories, according to their respective situations.
Question: What kind of ignorance does not exist, so that formations do not exist?
What kind of cessation of ignorance causes the cessation of formations?
Answer: There are three kinds of manifest entanglements,
dormant afflictions,
and ignorance.ğŸ”½Because of the cessation of this ignorance,
that ignorance ceases.
Because of its cessation,
formations also cease accordingly.
Question: What kind of formations do not exist, so that consciousness does not exist?
What kind of cessation of formations causes the cessation of consciousness?
Answer: The formations in one's own continuity,
having been created and having ceased,
And before the arising of the antidote.
Moreover, because of the existence of mental activity,
Bodily and verbal activity arise.
Because of this existence,
That exists.
Because that does not exist, the consciousness that is its condition also does not exist.
If this is completely extinguished,
One should know that consciousness will also be extinguished.
Question: Due to the non-existence of which consciousness is name-and-form said to be non-existent?
Due to the cessation of which consciousness is name-and-form said to cease?
Answer: Due to the non-existence of the seed consciousness,
The fruit consciousness does not exist.
Because these two cease together,
Name-and-form is said to cease together.
Just as consciousness is related to name-and-form,
In the same way, the remaining links up to feeling,
According to their respective situations,
Should also be understood in the same way.
Just as ignorance is a condition for volitional activity, in the same way craving is a condition for grasping,
And grasping is a condition for becoming,
Should also be understood in the same way.
Just as volitional activity is a condition for consciousness,
In the same way, becoming is a condition for birth,
Should also be understood in the same way.
Just as consciousness is a condition for name-and-form,
Birth is a condition for aging and death,
One should understand it is the same.
Question: What kind of feeling not existing causes craving not to exist?
What kind of feeling ceasing causes craving to cease? Answer: One should understand it is the same as the principle of formations conditioning consciousness.
Question: As for the eight dependent origination gates explained above,
how many gates are manifested by the twelve factors of dependent origination?
How many gates are not?
Answer: Three gates are manifested by it,
namely, two are manifested by a part,
and one is manifested by the whole.
The other gates are not.
What are the two manifested by a part?
Namely, the gate of the arising of internal consciousness,
and the gate of one's own karma being made.
What is the one manifested by the whole?
Namely, the gate of the transformation of the world of sentient beings.
Question: For one who does not understand the principle of dependent origination as it really is,
how many kinds of faults are there?
Answer: There are five,
namely, giving rise to the view of self,ğŸ”½and being able to give rise to the views associated with the past,
as with the views associated with the past,
The same applies to the view that accompanies the subsequent end.
The same applies to the view that accompanies both the past and future ends.
Moreover, regarding that view, one has intense and firm grasping,
with attachment and fear.
In the present life,
one does not attain parinirvÄá¹‡a.
This is called the fifth disadvantage.
Question: How many kinds of benefits are there for one who knows reality?
Answer: It should be known that the benefits are also of five kinds, the opposite of the previous five disadvantages.
Next, regarding this twelve-fold dependent origination,
how many factors are real?
It is said that nine are real.
How many factors are not real?
It is said that the rest are not real.
How many have the nature of being one thing?
It is said that five have the nature of being one thing.
How many do not have the nature of being one thing?
It is said that the rest do not have the nature of being one thing.
How many are the causes of the obstacle of knowables?
It is said that one is the cause of the obstacle of knowables.
How many produce suffering?
It is said that five produce suffering.
How many are the wombs of suffering?
It is said that five are the wombs of suffering.
How many are only suffering?
It is said that two are only suffering.
How many are called the causal aspect?
It is said that the first six are the causal aspect.
From ignorance up to contact.
And craving, grasping, and becoming are said to be the causal part.
How many are said to be the resultant part?
The latter two are said to be the resultant part.
How many are said to be the mixed cause and effect part?
The remaining members are said to be the mixed part.
Why is this?
There are two kinds of feeling.
It is called the mixed part.ğŸ”½One is the feeling that is the cause with contact as its condition in the future life.
The other is the feeling that is the effect with craving as its condition in the present life.
These two are mixed and said to be feeling with contact as its condition.
Next, how many members are able to produce the fruits of desirable and undesirable objects?
How many members are able to produce the fruits of their own bodies?
The first six members are able to produce the former fruits.
The latter three members are able to produce the latter fruits.
One member produces both kinds of fruits simultaneously.
Next, how many members are associated with pleasant feeling?
Excluding two, the remaining members.
How many members are associated with painful feeling?
It is just those, and one of those excluded.
How many members are associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling?
It should be known that they are like the case of pleasant feeling.
How many members are not associated with feeling?
It is the one that is excluded.
Next, how many members are included in the suffering of change?
They are the members associated with pleasant feeling,
and a part of the members not associated with feeling.ğŸ”½How many members are included in the suffering of pain?
They are the members associated with painful feeling,
and a part of the members not associated with feeling.
How many members are included in the suffering of conditioned existence?ğŸ”½They are the suffering of change,ğŸ”½and the members of the suffering of pain,
which are also members of the suffering of conditioned existence.
Or there may be members included in the suffering of conditioned existence,
but not in the other two kinds of suffering.
They are the members associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling,
and a part of the members not associated with feeling.
Question: In all places of rebirth and in the meditative absorptions,
can the actualities of all the members be obtained?
Answer: They cannot be obtained.
In the heaven of non-perceptual beings,
and in the attainment of cessation,
In the attainment of non-perception,
the form components can be obtained,
but not the formless components.
If one is born in the formless realm,
the formless components can be obtained,
but not the form components.
Question: Can one be detached from a component by relying on a component?
Answer: There is.
That is, by relying on the components of the upper stages,
one is detached from the components of the lower stages.
This is only a part, not the whole.
It is only temporary, not ultimate.
Question: How many components are defiled?
How many components are undefiled?
Answer: Three are defiled.
The rest are of both kinds.
If they are undefiled,
they are classified as good and unobscured-indeterminate.
One should know that they are divided into two kinds.
Question: How many components are bound to the desire realm?
Answer: All components.
Because they arise in combination, etc.
Question: How many components are bound to the form realm?
Answer: All of them are part of it.
Question: How should one know that they have aging?
Answer: Because those conditioned factors have the nature of decay and corruption.
Like those bound to the form realm,
It should be known that the same applies to the formless realm.
How many factors are learners?
The answer is none.
How many factors are post-learners?
The answer is also none.
How many factors are neither learners nor post-learners?
The answer is all.
How is it that all wholesome and contaminated factors
are not learners?
The answer is because they fall into the cycle of birth and death.
If wholesome and contaminated dharmas belong to learners,
they are in opposition to the cycle of birth and death.
And because they take clear understanding as a condition, they are not factors.
How many factors should the fruit of stream-entry be said to have already eliminated?
The answer is: all in part, none in their entirety.
Just as with the fruit of stream-entry,
the same applies to the fruit of once-returning.
How many factors should the fruit of non-returning be said to have already eliminated?
The answer is: all in the desire realm,
in the form and formless realms it is not definite.
How many factors have already been eliminated?
The answer is: all in the three realms.
Furthermore, in those various sÅ«tras,
By how many kinds of statements of principles is dependent origination explained?
In brief, it is explained by six kinds of statements of principles.
First, by sequential statements.
Second, by reverse sequential statements.
Third, by statements using one branch.
Fourth, by statements using complete branches.
Fifth, by statements using the black category.
Sixth, by statements using the white category.
The World-Honored One said that dependent origination is profound.ğŸ”½How should the meaning of this profundity
be understood?ğŸ”½The answer is:
The profound meaning of dependent origination should be understood by ten aspects.
That is to say, it is explained based on the meanings of impermanence,
suffering,
emptiness,
and non-self.
As for based on the meaning of impermanence,
it means arising from one's own seeds
and also depending on other conditions.
Moreover, arising from other conditions
also depends on one's own seeds.
Moreover, arising from one's own seeds and from other conditions,
the seeds and conditions in this process of arising
are without action and without function,
and also without movement.
Moreover, these two causes and natures have functions,
and they are not non-existent.
Moreover, all the factors of existence,
although they have been accomplished since beginningless time,
yet they are newly transformed in every moment.
Moreover, although the factors of dependent origination are quickly extinguished in every moment,
yet the appearance of their movement and abiding seems to be present.
As for the meaning of suffering,
it refers to the factors of dependent origination,
which have the characteristic of suffering as a single taste, but seem to manifest as three kinds of characteristics.
As for the meaning of emptiness,
it refers to the factors of dependent origination,
which are devoid of sentient beings, creators, and experiencers,
yet seem to be not devoid.
It is thus explained.
As for the meaning of non-self,
it refers to the factors of dependent origination,
which are not independent and truly lack the characteristic of self,
yet seem to manifest as the characteristic of self.
Based on the ultimate truth,
although the intrinsic nature of all dharmas cannot be spoken of,
it is said that the intrinsic nature of all dharmas can be spoken of.
Question: How many kinds of cognition should be used to cognize dependent origination?
Answer: Two.
It is said that one uses the knowledge of the abiding of dharmas,
and the knowledge of reality.
How does one use the knowledge of the abiding of dharmas?
It means knowing without error as the Buddha has established and revealed.
How does one use the knowledge of reality?
It means observing the profound meaning as one learns to see the traces.
Question: As the World-Honored One said,
This dependent arising,
is not made by me or anyone else.
Why is it so?
Whether a Buddha appears in the world
or does not appear in the world,
the nature of dharmas, the abiding of dharmas, and the realm of dharmas remain.
What is the nature of dharmas?
What is the abiding of dharmas?
What is the realm of dharmas?
Answer: This dependent arising,
from beginningless time,
the nature that is accomplished by principle is called the nature of dharmas.
As for the accomplished nature,
it is established with undistorted phrases and sentences.
This is called the abiding of dharmas.
Because of this abiding of dharmas, it takes that nature of dharmas as its cause.
Therefore, it is said to be called the realm of dharmas.
Question: As the sutra says,
If birth does not exist,
there is no place and no state
where birth could exist.
If birth does not exist in any way,
then aging and death conditioned by birth
should be unobtainable.
Why is it said here that the intrinsic nature conditions the intrinsic nature?
Answer: Because it is said that the effect arises from its own seeds.
That is to say, the links of consciousness up to feelingğŸ”½are the seeds of birth,
and therefore they are figuratively referred to as birth.
Because of their existence,
at a later time, this very effect link
is called existence conditioned by birth.
In this way, the other links
should be understood as explained in the sutra,
according to their respective contexts.
Question: It has already been said that all the links are not conditions for each other.
Why is it established that name-and-form and consciousness are conditions for each other?
Answer: Because in the present life,ğŸ”½consciousness uses name-and-form as a condition,
and name-and-form in turn uses consciousness as a condition in the future life.
Why is this so?ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Because in the mother's womb,
there is a time of continuity,
it is said that they are conditions for each other.
Due to consciousness as a condition,ğŸ”½in the mother's womb,
the blood and semen of the mother and father,
are included in name-and-form,
and together form the nature of the kalala.
This name-and-form as a condition,
further causes that consciousness to be able to abide in it.
Question: Why, when the Bodhisattva contemplates the black category,
does he only go up to the consciousness link,
and his mind turns back,
not going to the other links?
Answer: Because these two links are conditions for each other,
just as consciousness is a condition for name-and-form,
so name-and-form is also a condition for consciousness.
Therefore, when the mind contemplates up to consciousness, it turns back.
In the other links,
there is no such principle of turning back.
In this one place,
the principle of being conditions for each other is shown,
and therefore it is called turning back.
In the category of cessation,
name-and-form is not the cause for the cessation of the consciousness of future existence.
For this reason, one should further contemplate.
Question: For what reason is it said that the factors of dependent origination are not self-made,
not made by others,
not made by both,
and also not born without a cause?
Answer: Because the born does not exist,
because conditions have no function,
and because they are produced by the power of conditions.
Question: In dependent origination,
what is the sprout of suffering?
Who guards and nourishes the sprout of suffering?
What is the tree of suffering?
Answer: The sprout of suffering is from consciousness up to feeling, which is drawn by the conditions of ignorance and karmic formations.
Craving, up to existence, which is drawn by the condition of feeling, is the guarding and nourishing of the sprout of suffering.
Birth and old age and death
should be known as the tree of suffering.
Question: How many factors of dependent origination should be known as like a wick?
Answer: Consciousness up to feeling.
Question: How many factors are like oil?
Answer: Ignorance, karmic formations,
craving, grasping, and becoming.
Question: How many factors are like flames?
Answer: Birth, old age and death should be known.
Question: For what reason?
In the teachings on the dark side of dependent origination,
it is called increase.
The answer is: because all the factors lead to a great mass of suffering as their future result.ğŸ”½Moreover, the earlier factors serve as conditions for the later ones,
and the later ones follow accordingly.
The question is: for what reason,
in the teachings on the bright side,
is it called decrease?
The answer is: because by permanently cutting off the earlier factors, the later ones decrease.
And because it is the cause for decreasing the great mass of suffering.
The question is: how many factors of dependent origination are called dharmas with causes?
The answer is: the first seven.
The question is: how many factors of dependent origination are called suffering with causes?
The answer is: the remaining five.
The question is: how many factors of cessation are manifested by the exhaustion of defilements?
The answer is: three.
The question is: how many factors of cessation are manifested by the exhaustion of conditions?
The answer is: precisely these three are the conditions for the other factors.
The question is: how many factors of cessation are manifested by the exhaustion of feeling?
The answer is: one.
Namely, because the afflictions have already been cut off,
when the basis ceases,
all these feelings,
Because they are all eternally extinguished.
Question: For what causes and conditions?
Relying on dependent origination,
Are the seventy-seven knowledges established?
Answer: In order to manifest the knowledge of defiled dharmas with causes,
And also in order to manifest the knowledge of the defilement one has created in one's own continuity,
And also in order to manifest the beginninglessness of the members in the past,
And also in order to manifest the meaning of the defilement and cessation of the members in the future,
And also in order to manifest the meaning of the universal knowledge of all contaminated wisdom not included in the members,
In each member,
All have seven knowledges.
It should be known that there are a total of seventy-seven knowledges.
Question: For what causes and conditions?
In dependent origination,
Are the forty-four knowledges established?
Answer: In order to manifest the principle of contemplation of the four noble truths relying on each member,
Therefore there are a total of forty-four knowledges.
Furthermore, if one is born in the desire realm,
Relying on a body in the desire realm,ğŸ”½...
It can manifest the eyes and ears of higher stages.
Through this, one can see and hear colors and sounds of lower stages and one's own stage.
Moreover, based on this body,
one can give rise to the mind of the three realms and the unconditioned mind,
and manifest them in the present.
If one is born in the form realm or formless realm,
excluding the lower stages,
all manifest.
Like in the desire realm.
Furthermore, these three kinds of defilements,
namely the defilement of afflictions,
the defilement of karma,
and the defilement of birth,
in order to eliminate them,
one cultivates six kinds of clear realization.
One should know what they are.
Namely, the clear realization of reflection,
the clear realization of faith,
the clear realization of precepts,ğŸ”½the clear realization of the truth of the knowledge of clear realization,
the clear realization of the truth of the knowledge on the edge of clear realization,ğŸ”½and the ultimate clear realization.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Discourse on the Stages of Concentration Practice, Scroll 10
